Key Match Events: Garland drained a go-ahead 3-pointer with 45 seconds left
Mobley displayed his all-around game over a span of seven seconds in the second quarter
Jarrett Allen added 14 points, 15 rebounds and had a huge block on Milwaukee's Damian Lillard in the final seconds
Lillard scored 36 for the Bucks, but committed a costly turnover when he was called for an over-and-back violation with 56 seconds left
Pre-Game Insights: Antetokounmpo sat out with a strained adductor muscle, an injury the two-time MVP sustained during the loss to Cleveland
Post-Match Reflections: The Cavs also survived without Mitchell carrying them. He only scored one point after the first quarter, finishing with 14
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cavs were just the second team in history to start 7-0 with every player averaging less than 30 minutes. Seattle did it in 1978
Others: Bucks: Showed grit in giving all they had despite not having Antetokounmpo, who averages 31 points. Milwaukee's schedule hasn't helped, with five of seven games on the road
Cavaliers: Another good lesson to not take any team for granted
